column4: Since I upgraded to 10.0.4 LTS a few days ago, the PC crashes frequently. What should I do?
describe your crashing symptoms in more detail

I'm unsure about the exact circumstances as I'm not the only user of the machine, but the machine freezes up, no response on the caps lock light, the screen goes black, but the monitor power light is lit. I've been able to reboot some times by repeatedly hitting ctrl-alt-del
if you have no caps lock response, it tends to imply a complete hardware crash. try running memtest
I did the memory test, no problems there
that's not very old! that's moderately recent ;-)
anyway, what did you have on it before?

it's either a hardware problem, in which case any OS would fail at some point, or it's a kernel/hardware incompatibility/instability, in which case it may be able to be fixed by tweaking kernel parameters and/or using a different kernel
the trouble is finding out what the actual problem is
you could see if there is a BIOS upgrade from the BIOS manufacturer as the first port of call?
you could try turning off various things in the kernel parameters like acpi,
I mix up apic and acpi... I had to turn off one of those on an old machine to mak eit work
I don't have the BIOS password. I guess that precludes making any BIOS changes?
not if you don't mind doing a hard reset on the BIOS -- there's usually a jumper you can put on a pair of pins to wipe it
OK, that sounds feasible, except it's still a bit scary...
